explains: adj. 光荣的，值得称道的；辉煌的，绚丽的；极其愉快的；（天气）阳光灿烂的

sentences.en: Harrison had a glorious career spanning more than six decades.
sentences.cn: 哈里森有过一段长达六十余年的辉煌的职业生涯。

sentences.en: The award of the Nobel Prize has crowned a glorious career in physics.
sentences.cn: 荣获诺贝尔奖使其物理学研究的辉煌事业达到了顶点。

sentences.en: They had three weeks of glorious sunshine.
sentences.cn: 他们度过了三周阳光灿烂的日子。
